column1: If one of your parents had a stroke, you are at higher risk.
- Diseases such as cancer, chronic kidney disease, and some autoimmune diseases.
- Pregnancy, both during and in the weeks right after pregnancy.
Blood clots from the heart may travel to the brain and cause a stroke.
- Avoid foods with a lot of sodium (salt).
Your doctor may suggest taking aspirin or another drug called clopidogrel (Plavix) to help prevent blood clots from forming.
